availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Theodore Barrett Harlan (Ripley, Ohio, (N KY) 2nd lieut 10th KY Cav USA, pvt police guard KCRR, capt 11th OH Cav)

body.p: Brown County, Ohio, carpenter and soldier. Ohio native. Son of Jesse Harlan and Elizabeth Collins Harlan. Student in Brown County, Ohio, in 1850. Carpenter in Brown County in 1860. Joiner in Cincinnati in 1861. Served in the Police Guard for the Kentucky Central Railroad as a private from October 11, 1861, to December 1, 1861. Served in the 10th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as second lieutenant from September 2, 1862, to September 17, 1863. Received payment from United States Army for shoeing horses in Brooksville, Kentucky, in 1862. Served in the 11th Ohio Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as captain.
